channel.title: Software Engineering Degree
channel.description: Alright, I'm still not 100% sure what I'm wanting to major in, however I know the general area. I just can't decide what the best degree for me is, I'm looking for the most options, but I don't want to close myself out of other potential options with what I pick. "Software Engineering" is the degree I'm looking at, but there's so many different names I've seen when I look for stuff like this. I've seen a software development degree (Same think I'm sure as engineering), but sometimes I let myself get confused. I would like to be a software engineer, good pay and a fun job for me, however, I would like the chance at game development. Game development is a much smaller market than software engineering, which is why I don't want the degree for it, I know software engineering would be the safer route, but if I get the opportunity to work for a game developer, I'd like to. Mainly what I'm asking is what would be the best exact degree for me to go after? Sometimes it feels like there's a lot of pressure on this topic because I hear people talking about some who get their degree and don't have anywhere to go, and I don't want to be that guy. What do you guys think?

item.title: Software Engineering Degree
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Alright, I’m still not 100% sure what I’m wanting to major in, however I know the general area. I just can’t decide what the best degree for me is, I’m looking for the most options, but I don’t want to close myself out of other potential options with what I pick. “Software Engineering” is the degree I’m looking at, but there’s so many different names I’ve seen when I look for stuff like this. I’ve seen a software development degree (Same think I’m sure as engineering), but sometimes I let myself get confused. I would like to be a software engineer, good pay and a fun job for me, however, I would like the chance at game development. Game development is a much smaller market than software engineering, which is why I don’t want the degree for it, I know software engineering would be the safer route, but if I get the opportunity to work for a game developer, I’d like to. Mainly what I’m asking is what would be the best exact degree for me to go after? Sometimes it feels like there’s a lot of pressure on this topic because I hear people talking about some who get their degree and don’t have anywhere to go, and I don’t want to be that guy. What do you guys think?
